meanings.sent1: The immanence beauty of the sunset filled the sky with colors.
meanings.sent2: The immanence connection between the siblings was evident in their shared laughter.
meanings.sent3: The immanence joy of the puppy chasing its tail brought smiles to everyone watching.
meanings.sent4: The immanence calmness of the lake mirrored the tranquility of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The immanence scent of fresh flowers in the garden lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: Inherent in the nature of something; existing throughout and within something.
meanings.sent1: The immanence truth of his words resonated with everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The immanence warmth of the fireplace made the living room cozy on a cold night.
meanings.sent3: The immanence humor of the comedian had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The immanence strength of the old tree roots kept it standing tall through many storms.
meanings.sent5: The immanence aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen with a comforting smell.
